top.title: Kremlin signals no breakthrough after Ukraine talks with US
top.summary: Kremlin officials describe the five hours of talks as "constructive" but say "a lot of work lies ahead".

top.title: Ukrainians in war-ravaged Donbas weigh prospects of peace deal
top.summary: While many Ukrainians believe they have sacrificed too much for their country to lose territory to Russia, others are desperate for the war to end.

top.title: US Navy admiral ordered second  deadly Venezuela boat strike, White House says
top.summary: The strikes, authorised by Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth, have raised fresh legality questions - but the White House says laws have been followed.

top.title: YouTuber Marques Brownlee shutting down phone wallpaper app
top.summary: The app, which was criticised at launch for its $11.99 (£9) a month fee, will close on 31 December.

top.title: Fashion house Valentino criticised over 'disturbing' AI handbag ads
top.summary: Social media users have called the luxury Italian fashion brand's artificial intelligence-made adverts "cheap" and "lazy".

top.title: 'First of its kind' scanner to study blast trauma
top.summary: It will be able to monitor changes in brain function just minutes after weapon use, scientists say.

title.#text: The Polaroid Flip, my favorite retro instant camera, is cheaper than ever
Indiegogo is launching ‘Express Crowdfunding’ so creators can ship things sooner
Google is experimentally replacing news headlines with AI clickbait nonsense
